website_summaries.verdict: While Louisville Slugger may be better known for its wooden baseball bats, this affordable alloy model is a good transition from wood to metal in league play.
pros: Meets the standards for numerous leagues, from pony to collegiate
Special end cap increases bat speed
Alloy construction provides a stiffer response than wood or aluminum
cons: One-piece design can cause significant vibration in hands
Some dents reported after minimal use

customer_reviews.title: Got the 29/18 for my 9 year old boy, he loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This bat has a very nice grip and is lightweight with a nice pop for the weight it has. If you want a better pop need a heavier bat, but for contact this is great. The only thing is pay attention for the different pricing for the sizes, don't pay more than $100 as they are always changing. A great price would be $70-100.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Swings lighter than All One piece bats!!
customer_reviews.text: Have smaller boy in the 7-8u Player Pitch Travel ball. Been struggling to find a light swinging bat for him. Added 2 choke up rings and he now has his confidence back. Swings light / Less sting / decent pop and stands out in the Bat Rack. For a USA bat that’s ONE piece you can’t go wrong. ( Bought DeMarini Sabotage - Too heavy of an end cap makes it swing like a drop 5)- Easton Ghost stung like crazy - Marucci Cat 7 barrel to big for new USA standards . Good luck out there
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bat for my 9/10 year old
customer_reviews.text: This bat is great for my son he loves it. Great for really working on fundamentals and making contact with the ball.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cummins

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been coaching Little League for years and have constantly watched kids swing bats that were too heavy. This one has a nice weight distribution, very acceptable -11 length to weight ratio, had the correct weight (as advertised) when it arrived, and has the larger barrel for 8-10 year olds. We also considered the 2-1/2' barrel version that is a -13 but my son thought it was too light when he tried it. My 9 year old loves it as a replacement for his Easton. Very sold bat for the price. Plenty of power in it for kids in the intended age range.
customer_reviews.author: JohnsDad

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Probably not the best Louisville USA bat but still pretty good..we like the selects best..more because the vibration....USA bats are designed to develop youth players swings better for the future....So if your looking for any special pop there really isn’t a magic USA bat
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Stambaugh

customer_reviews.title: Good for very young hitters
customer_reviews.text: Has a little too much vibration. My 6 yr old uses the 28 size. He's considered a better than avg hitter for his age. This bat does have some decent pop and when he connects, it does go farther than his other bat. For a Star Wars fan, he loves the name and the colors. Thankfully we got an amazing deal during the holidays. I'd be disappointed if I paid over 100.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Strong

customer_reviews.title: Huge vibration
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son after reading reviews. He could literally not hit the ball without hurting his hands, despite padded tape and wearing gloves. Used it for 2 weeks and then I ended up buying him a composite bat (which he has used with zero problem). I have bought many other 1 piece bats before and read great reviews on this one, but would happily return it if that was an option...pretty sure since it was used it likely just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Solid bat, one of the best overall USA Baseball bats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to move up in size from my son's 618 solo. The 618 was a great balanced bat for him and he feels the same about this one two. Very balanced in its feel. The only negative is that the grip is no longer a Lizard Skin grip and the grip seems thinner now. My son noticed that change immediately. Otherwise he was all smiles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bat
customer_reviews.text: Son 9 going 10 had good results with this bat. Had a omaha bat 2 seasons ago switched to a rawlings last season and came back to louisville for the 2020 season. Hasn't used in a game yet but looks good in the cage on the tee and practice on the field. Provides a niece level swing and a nice pop on impact. Happy so far with the product.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Sandlot kids would love this bat! It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son is a home run hitter in the making using any bat, but this bat is his favorite! It’s tough and takes the heavy swings at little league.
customer_reviews.author: Combat Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Great bats grandson just loves it he's hitting the ball ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bats grandson just loves it he's hitting the ball well now improved his game thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great bat
customer_reviews.text: quick shipping and a great bat. Has a good sweet spot and has increased my son's hitting greatly over previous bats
customer_reviews.author: batman414

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic USA bat
customer_reviews.text: Love this bat, only negative is it can sting your hands. I bought 2 for my son 1 for practice and 1 for game time.
customer_reviews.author: Jradhouser

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for my 10yr old. My son needed a USA bat this year as he is playing both rec and travel ball he has the solo in USSSA but wanted the USA version. NO issues with the bat
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great bat
customer_reviews.text: Great bat for my 8 year old . He loves it ! Hitting well
customer_reviews.author: Mandy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bat for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Our 11yo needed a lighter swinging bat for Little League. This bat has the lightest swing and lots of pop. Highly recommended for line drive hitters that try to keep up with advanced pitching.
customer_reviews.author: Bas

customer_reviews.title: Good bat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old. He is in the smaller side and it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son before the All-Star tournament started. Very balance bat. Multiple kids used it. Good pop right off the box. Great bat for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Bonet

customer_reviews.title: Top end bat, low end close out price!
customer_reviews.text: This bat is money! Getting a bat of this caliber at close out pricing should be a crime. This stick is comparable to the Easton Beast.
customer_reviews.author: Bat Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: 31in/20oz
customer_reviews.text: terrible bat more sting than hitting it of the end with a wood bat decent pop if you hit it in the grape sized sweet spot but i love Louisville slugger bats so i would ether go down to a Omaha or up to a select because they both are better.
customer_reviews.author: amy elins

customer_reviews.title: 5-Star Solo Dinger!
customer_reviews.text: Great bat at a Great price. The LS Select is nice, but very expensive. Hoping for some Solo shots with the new LS Solo...
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound when hitting the ball, sturdy quality. Not much sting when hitting the ball with the wrong spot.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great bat
customer_reviews.text: Nice bat with a great pop. My 12 year old loves it
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.text: Finally a USAA bat that is the advertised weight at 17.3 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Rohrbach

customer_reviews.title: Was suppose to be new.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bat, but is damage. Large scrape, see pic. Waited 2 days for it, have to see what are my options.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bat for the money. Works as well as my son’s USSSA bats that are twice the price or more. He needed this to play in a league and loves it for all games even tournaments!
customer_reviews.author: HOLLYDAZE

customer_reviews.title: Little league bat
customer_reviews.text: This bat has no pop whatsoever. My nine year old can drive the ball much further with a wood bat. All of the USA bats are weak and I guess that is by design, but there is no advantage with this bat compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mirroimage4

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Performance
customer_reviews.text: This bat hits the ball further than the more expensive bats on the market. It looks awesome and nearly every kid on the team wants to use it. Durability has been fine so far and we still have a few of last years models in our dugout. Solo is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: ak

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Bat that rattles
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old who uses this bat and the first one had a rattle as if there was sand inside the barrel. LS replaced it with a new bat. Same issue with the new bat. They obviously cut corners in the manufacturing process on this series. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than most 30" USA bats.  Great for youth baseball
customer_reviews.text: My son plays 9u tournament baseball. He absolutely loves this bat and has really been crushing the ball. Also since the bat is lighter than most 30inch, he is able to swing much faster therefore being able to catch those pitches out front. We were very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Channette Hughes

product_meta.title: Louisville Slugger 2019 Solo 619 (-11) 2 5/8" USA Baseball Bat
product_meta.description: When you need to come up with a big hit, this is the bat for you. The solo 619 (-11) 2 5/8 inch USA Baseball bat is one of the lightest-swinging bats in the 2019 Louisville Slugger USA lineup, making it the ideal choice for players looking to square up some high heat. A one-piece SL Hyper alloy construction lends a stiffer feel and maximum energy transfer on contact. A speed ballistic composite (SBC) end cap helps further increase swing speed and bat control and the all-new Louisville Slugger Pro comfort grip gives you the perfect mix of tack and cushion. Don't miss your pitch. Make every swing count and choose your bat from the most trusted lineup in the game: Louisville Slugger.
feature_bullets: Meets USA bat standard; approved for play in little League Baseball, aabc, AAU, Babe Ruth/cal ripken Baseball, Dixie Youth Baseball, and pony Baseball
1-piece sl hyper alloy construction for a stiffer feel and maximum energy transfer on contact
Sbc) speed Ballistic composite end cap - for increased swing speed and maximum bat control through the zone
New LS Pro comfort grip for the perfect Mix of tack and cushion
